title: Former Home and Away star Dan Ewing nabs first Hollywood film role in Paramount's Monster Problems
text:
Former Home and Away star Dan Ewing has announced that he's nabbed his first major Hollywood studio role.

The 34-year-old, who was best known for playing River Boy Heath Braxton on the long-running Australian soap, is set to star in Paramount's coming-of-age movie, Monster Problems.

Taking to Instagram to confirm the news, Dan posted an excerpt from a Deadline article that confirmed the flick's star-studded cast.

Welcome to Hollywood: Former Home and Away star Dan Ewing nabs first blockbuster film role in Paramount's Monster Problems

'April 2020 baby!', he wrote in the caption, alongside the hashtag '#monsterproblems'.

The hunky actor will star in the film alongside The Maze Runner's Dylan O'Brien and Game of Thrones star, Jessica Henwick.

Billed as a mix between both Mad Max and Zombieland, Monster Problems centers around a young man living in a post-apocalyptic world overrun with monsters.

Star studded: Dan will star in the film alongside The Maze Runner's Dylan O'Brien [Left] and Game of Thrones star, Jessica Henwick [Right]

News of Dan's casting comes after it was announced that Paramount was strategically dealing with the film's release date, pushing it back six weeks.

Dan's new role comes following his messy split with his ex-wife Marni Little.

In November 2018, Dan made headlines when it was alleged he assaulted Marni's new husband David Robertshaw during a custody handover of he and Marni's son, Archie, five.

Dan was made to face a court in Sydney's beach-side suburb of Manly after police pursued an apprehended violence order (AVO) on behalf of David Robertshaw.

The incident between the two is alleged to have occurred after Dan refused to hand over his son to David after his regular Saturday night custody.

authors: Joe Scek For Daily Mail Australia
